Articles.Content: There was a flash update that removed the launcher
Oh, by the Krakens, thank you very much for it!
It will not be missed! T2 actually improved something by removing themselves from it no less.

So I wasn't imagining it...  now I can remove the thing from the drive and add 10% to my free space.

 

ps... what is the safe way to remove it without leaving a trail of loose ends?  It didn't appear in the apps & features list.

Edited Tuesday at 10:47 AM by Mickel

2 hours ago, Mickel said:

So I wasn't imagining it...  now I can remove the thing from the drive and add 10% to my free space.

 

ps... what is the safe way to remove it without leaving a trail of loose ends?  It didn't appear in the apps & features list.

The launcher is like 25MB. Really no point, just ignore it.


Otherwise just backup and then manually delete Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\Launcher_Data and Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\Launcher.exe and see what happens.

The PD Launcher folder is taking ~1.2Gb of drive space, so I don't know what they've got in there.  Probably updates that didn't delete previous versions.  I'll drag it to another drive and see what happens.  If nothing, I'll ditch it.

10 minutes ago, Mickel said:

The PD Launcher folder is taking ~1.2Gb of drive space, so I don't know what they've got in there.  Probably updates that didn't delete previous versions.  I'll drag it to another drive and see what happens.  If nothing, I'll ditch it.

Time to download the latest pristine KSP v1.12.5 to get the benefits of this.
On steam changelog there was a note to say sign up to PD for feedback re. KSP2 Features.  Feels like the wrong game!
Thanks for posting this. I was looking through my games list and nearly tossed my keyboard in surprise when I saw "Update Queued".
